books.author: Jodi Picoult
books.description: After surviving a plane crash, a death doula travels to Egypt to reconnect with an old flame who is an archaeologist.
books.title: THE BOOK OF TWO WAYS

books.author: James Patterson and J.D. Barker
books.contributor: by James Patterson and J.D. Barker
books.description: A detective and an F.B.I. agent are baffled by a cross-country killing spree.
books.title: THE COAST-TO-COAST MURDERS

books.author: Ken Follett
books.description: In a prequel to “The Pillars of the Earth,” a boatbuilder, a Norman noblewoman and a monk live in England under attack by the Welsh and the Vikings.
books.title: THE EVENING AND THE MORNING

books.author: Craig Johnson
books.description: The 16th book in the Longmire series. A million dollars in a shoebox and a piece of a painting might be clues to an art heist.
books.title: NEXT TO LAST STAND

books.author: Kyle Mills
books.description: When America’s power grid is shut down, Mitch Rapp goes after a cyber terrorist.
books.title: VINCE FLYNN: TOTAL POWER

books.author: Brit Bennett
books.description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.
books.title: THE VANISHING HALF

books.author: Fredrik Backman
books.description: A failed bank robber holds a group of strangers hostage at an apartment open house.
books.title: ANXIOUS PEOPLE

books.author: Robert Galbraith
books.description: The fifth book in the Cormoran Strike series. A decades-old cold case might be connected to a serial killer; by J.K. Rowling, writing pseudonymously.
books.title: TROUBLED BLOOD

books.author: Louise Penny
books.description: The 16th book in the Chief Inspector Gamache series. When his billionaire godfather is attacked, Gamache uncovers secrets hidden throughout Paris.

books.author: Ruth Ware
books.description: An avalanche tests the bonds of coworkers from a London-based tech startup on a corporate retreat in the French Alps.
books.title: ONE BY ONE

books.description: The 51st book of the In Death series. A hitman with possible connections to Eve Dallas’s husband is seen near the scene of a crime.

books.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

books.description: A failed bank robber holds a group of strangers hostage at an apartment open house. Read by Marin Ireland. 9 hours, 53 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ANXIOUS PEOPLE

books.author: Nicholas Sparks
books.description: A doctor serving in the Navy in Afghanistan goes back to North Carolina where two women change his life. Read by Kyf Brewer. 9 hours, 56 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE RETURN

books.author: Brit Bennett
books.description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge but their fates intertwine. Read by Shayna Small. 11 hours, 34 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE VANISHING HALF

books.author: Bob Woodward
books.description: Based on 17 on-the-record interviews with President Trump and other reporting, the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist details the president’s perspective on multiple crises. Read by Robert Petkoff. 13 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: RAGE

books.author: Michael Cohen
books.description: An account of President Trump’s business empire, political campaign and presidential administration by his former personal attorney. Read by Robert Petkoff. 11 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DISLOYAL

books.author: as told to Alex Haley
books.description: The life story of a leader in the Black Muslim movement and his views on racism in American society. Read by Laurence Fishburne. 16 hours, 52 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE AUTOBIOGRAPHY OF MALCOLM X

books.author: Candace Owens
books.description: The conservative commentator makes her case that Black Americans should part ways with the Democratic Party. Read by the author. 6 hours, 51 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BLACKOUT

books.author: Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today. Read by Robin Miles. 14 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CASTE

books.author: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff
books.description: The former director of special events at Vogue describes parting ways with the first lady. Read by the author. 11 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MELANIA AND ME

books.author: Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNTAMED

books.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg with Mary Hartnett and Wendy W. Williams
books.contributor: by Ruth Bader Ginsburg with Mary Hartnett and Wendy W. Williams
books.description: A collection of articles and speeches by the Supreme Court justice. Read by Linda Lavin. 13 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MY OWN WORDS

books.author: Stephen Fry
books.description: Whimsical retelling of Greek myths. Read by the author. 15 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MYTHOS

books.author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.contributor: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The ninth book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series focuses on conflicts with Native Americans. Read by Bill O’Reilly and Robert Petkoff. 9 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: KILLING CRAZY HORSE

books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BECOMING

books.author: Peter Strzok
books.description: The former F.B.I. deputy assistant director of counterintelligence chronicles the investigation into Russia’s election interference and key moments from his career. Read by the author. 14 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: COMPROMISED

books.author: Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism. Read by the author. 10 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: Mary L Trump
books.description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump. Read by the author. 7 hours, 5 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH

books.author: Mariah Carey with Michaela Angela Davis
books.contributor: by Mariah Carey with Michaela Angela Davis
books.description: The career highlights, personal struggles and public life events of the singer and songwriter. Read by Mariah Carey. 11 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.

books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.

books.description: A love develops between a charming werewolf and a 300-year-old vampire.
